entry.title: Combined summary - Bitcoin Enhancement Proposals (BEPS)
entry.summary: In September 2011, a member of the Bitcoin Development mailing list suggested adding the Bitcoin Improvement Proposals (BEPs) to a Github repository. The BEPs are a set of guidelines for improving the Bitcoin protocol and its associated software. By adding them to GitHub, developers could collaborate on proposals and ultimately enhance the Bitcoin network. However, there were concerns raised about the use of Git or GitHub as Python does not use them, and suggestions were made to consider alternatives such as PEPs.During the email thread, Gavin Andresen proposed that new transaction forms would be perfect candidates for BEPS, and he suggested a formal proposal to separate the protocol version from the client version. There was also discussion about renaming BEPs to avoid confusion with BitTorrent EPs in the future. Alternative names such as "BIP" (Bitcoin Improvement Proposal), "PEB" (Proposal to Enhance Bitcoin), or "BER" (Bitcoin Enhancement Request) were suggested as replacements for BEP. Later, it was suggested that keeping the current acronym may not be a significant issue. The importance of collaboration and organization in improving the Bitcoin network was highlighted throughout the email thread. Additionally, Bobby Groff's pull request was mentioned, along with his offer to maintain a similar index if people were interested.The post discusses the possibility of renaming the "BEP" acronym for Bitcoin Enhancement Proposals to avoid potential confusion with BitTorrent EPs in the future. Gavin Andresen proposed alternative names such as "BIP" (Bitcoin Improvement Proposal), "PEB" (Proposal to Enhance Bitcoin), or "BER" (Bitcoin Enhancement Request). He expressed concern that planning for the name now could save some confusion later. The author also proposes a formal proposal to separate the protocol version from the client version. Later, it is suggested that there may not be a significant issue with keeping the current acronym.The post also talks about adapting Python PEP 0001 to Bitcoin and creating an index similar to the one used by Python for BEPs. It is mentioned that Git/GitHub is working but not ideal for everyone, and it would be helpful to have feedback on what needs changing and how important it is. The recommendation is to continue with the current system but plan alternative organization voting around the time of 0.5 release, which could be an alternative to GitHub or a supplement or neither. Finally, the PEP system is considered a solid alternative/supplement to consider.
